story:
Hallo I’m Alberto from Rome and I’m a Citroën-addict. 

I’m starting this crowdfunding campaign to ask you a free contribution in order to be able to repair a mechanical damage  at the hydraulic engine of my beloved 1972’s Citroën DS. 

Since always I’ve been in love with historical cars. My special passion goes to Citroën. Why Citroën? because of the fantastic design and their personality. 

My first car was a Ami 8 Break or, as we used to call it in Italy, ‘Weekend’. With her I spent my first adventures as a young driver in rallies all over Italy.  

But the second Citroën I bought was actually my first love: Citroën DS. In french you read DS ‘déesse’ that means goddess. That’s what she was for me, the car I’ve always been dreaming of since I was watching as a little boy the adventure of Fantomas in the french movies played by Jean Marais, e Louis de Funès. 


The car you see in the video produced by myself and my friends is my second ‘goddess’. I bought her in Rome and she also had her glory moment with an appearance in the famous Italian tv series “Romanzo Criminale”,  about Rome’s Underworld in the 70s. 

My passion for the car is so big that I got mistaken and call my girlfriend ‘my DS’ making her really angry.

Because of all that I ask you a little help since, because of personal problems, my DS didn’t move for the past two years and I don’t have the financial possibility to repair it.

I will attach here the budget for the engine. The rest of the sum of my crowdfunding goal will go for other small restoration works on the car. Thanks everybody! 

Alberto

Ciao sono Alberto da Roma, e sono un citroenista.  

Tramite questo crowdfunding chiedo un libero contributo necessario a poter riparare il danno meccanico al sistema idraulico della mia amata Citroën DS del 1972 da alcuni anni ferma perché purtroppo non ho avuto e tutt'ora non ho la somma necessaria per affrontare la spesa.

Da sempre sono innamorato delle macchine d'epoca. In particolare la mia passione è per le Citroen. Perché le Citroen? Per il design e la personalità che sprigionano. 

La mia prima auto è stata una Ami8 Break  o come veniva chiamata in Italia 'Weekend'. Con lei ho trascorso le mie prime avventure nei raduni a giro per l'Italia. La seconda acquistata usata in quel di Brescia è stata la Citroen DS. In francese DS si legge déesse, la dea. E così era ed è per me quella macchina che sognavo fin da quando ero bambino e guardavo rapito i film Francesi di Fantomas con Jean Marais, e Louis de Funès. 


Questa che vedete nel video è la seconda Dea che possiedo, l'ho comprata a Roma ed ha avuto anche il suo momento di gloria con una piccola parte da comparsa nella serie 'Romanzo Criminale', serie ambientata nella Roma criminale degli anni 70. E' talmente grande la passione per questa Dea che ogni tanto mi sbaglio e chiamo 'mia DS' la mia compagna che si arrabbia non poco. 

Per questo vi chiedo un piccolo aiuto poiché per problemi personali la macchina è restata ferma per due anni e non ho la possibilità di ripararla. 

Vi allego copia del preventivo per la riparazione. Il resto della somma raccolta servirà per piccoli restauri alla carrozzeria. grazie a tutte e tutti!

Alberto

The budget for the engine/Copia del preventivo per la riparazione

story:
ALT MODE is a performance where artist present themselves how they see themselves without a commercialized agenda.
We have over 20 team members putting together this vision and artistic statement, please help to pay the artists so we can make this incredible!

A L T M O D E 

Alt Mode is a live music, modern dance, multi-media performance with 3D mapping, created by the artist, composer and producer RYAT. RYAT collaborates with Director/Choreographer Kate Watson-Wallace and an all female dance, VJ and designer cast. The team redefines and presents the modern day female artist, separating from the mainstream fabrication of what women are. 

This campaign funds the rehearsals and development of Alt Mode, before it premiers at Summer Stage in Central Park in NY for their 30th Anniversey. This performance will be free to the public. The show will continue to tour throughout the U.S. and Europe in 2016. With your help, these donations will go exclusively to artists for creation and rehearsal time. For each donation there is a special thanks that grants further insight into the production of Alt-Mode.


_______CORE CREATIVE TEAM_______

RYAT              (Creator/Composer/Performer)

Ever evolving in music and art, RYAT comes from the land of meditative avant jazz improvisations, classical analyzing, hip-hop sampling culture, electronic beat-making, sound processing, multi-medium performance and visual experimentation. Currently residing in LA, RYAT is composing for film and dance, and produces conceptual albums. RYAT has been commissioned by the Annenberg Foundation for PIFA festival, and she has also collaborated with groups including Nadastrom, jazz artists like Taylor McFerrin and Mark Guiliana, as well as electronic innovators King Britt and Cinematic Orchestra. RYAT enjoys working with many different kinds of artists across all mediums to create futuristic sounds and visual experiences.

For 2015, RYAT will be debuting a new orchestral piece written for the Echo Society's Bloom Event. RYAT will also be debuting a new interdisciplinary performance for her live show entitled “Alt Mode” at SummerStage August 19th, 2015 in Central Park. “Alt Mode” is a mixed media modern dance piece in collaboration with Director and Choreographer Kate Watson-Wallace that contains live music, 3-D mapping, interactive technology and members of the Fresh Cut Orchestra.

RYAT has performed in Europe, Japan, the United States and Canada, and has shared stages with artists including Amon Tobin, Flying Lotus and Thom Yorke (with Modeselektar). She has been featured at Gilles Peterson Worldwide Showcase in Japan, Coachella, SXSW and venues such as the Brooklyn Hall of Music, The Echoplex, Fringe Arts Philadelphia, University of California at Irvine, and Temple University. RYAT’s compositions have been performed by the London Contemporary Choir and the Echo Society Chamber Orchestra, and she is currently scoring a short film about women graffiti artists in Afghanistan.    

Label: TO BE ANNOUNCED


Kate Watson-Wallace  (Director/Choreographer)

Kate Watson-Wallace is a choreographer, director, and visual artist based in Brooklyn, NY. She creates experimental performance for the stage, site-based locations, and music videos.

Her interactive and site-based performance work has been funded by The Map Fund, Doris Duke Foundation through Creative Capital, Pew Center for Arts & Heritage, Independence Foundation, The Mid Atlantic Arts Foundation, and PA Council on the Arts. She is a 2007 Pew Fellow in the Arts in Choreography. She has choreographed music videos for Animal Collective, Black Dice (DFA Records), Dead Skeletons and RYAT (Brainfeeder). She has performed with Elvis Costello,

ManMan, Spank Rock, and Headlong. Corporate choreographic commissions include: an interactive site-based performance inside a Kimpton boutique hotel, a dance on bicycles for the opening of Hotel Monaco, underwater choreography for Hotel Intercontinental LA (in collaboration with klip collective), and a site-based work inside the Real World house for Redbull. 

Her collaborative company with artist Jaamil Kosoko and producer King Britt, Anonymous Bodies, has shown work internationally, including: Moma PS1, Fringe Arts, Dance Theater Workshop, Dance New Amsterdam, Joyce SoHo, The Yard, Harlem Stage at The Gatehouse, Dance Place, ODC Dance, Velocity Dance Center, Movement Research, Kelly Strayhorn Theater, Bryn Mawr College Performing Arts Series, The Kimmel Center, and Philadelphia Dance Projects. She has taught extensively at universities throughout the U.S.. She is currently an MFA candidate at The School of the Art Institute of Chicago in Studio Art. 


Jasmine Hearn                                        (Lead Dancer)

Jasmine Hearn, a native Houstonian, graduated magna cum laude from from Point Park University with her B.A. in Dance.  Beginning her dance training at the Houston Metropolitan Dance Center, Jasmine also performed and trained at Episcopal High School under the direction of Evelyn Ireton and Frank Vega.  She was an intern with the Houston Met Dance Company her senior year of high school and a mentee of dance artist, jhon r. stronks.

Jasmine has had the wonderful opportunity to have performed premiere works by Helen Simoneau, Mark Dendy, and Robert Battle. She has danced with Dance Alloy Theater, the August Wilson Dance Ensemble, Gia T. Presents, and the Pillow Project. Jasmine has currently worked with the Staycee Pearl dance project (PGH), Marjani Forte (NYC), anonymous bodies (PHIL), and Helen Simoneau Danse (Winston-Salem) over the past year.

Jasmine also creates her own work; her solo, if god left the lights on could we walk alone in the dark has premiered in Pittsburgh, Philadelphia, New York City, and Houston.  She has participated in the newMoves Emerging Choreographers Festival in 2012 and 2013, the Alloy Studios' new program, Freshworks in 2013, and has also shown work in independent showcases in the area.  Jasmine has currently directed, choreographed, and produced a summer/fall dance series, that’s what she said that were performed in site specific locations in the Garfield and East Liberty neighborhoods.  

She has been working with Alisha B. Wormsley for over the past year in her video series, the children of NAN. Their current collaboration will continue in upcoming projects and residencies.  

Jasmine is also responsible for sporadic citrus series: Improv Jam happenings that have been found at Point Park University, the Space Upstairs, the Alloy Studios, and the PearlArts Studios. 


Diana Wyenn          (Dramaturg/Multimedia Director)

Director Diana Wyenn is a Los Angeles based director/choreographer, designer and performer with a socially driven, interdisciplinary practice. Recent directing credits include: Jon Bastian’s Bill & Joan (world premiere), Susan Josephs’ The Interview (world premiere), Michael Kass’ Ceremony (world premiere), and Dario Fo’s Accidental Death of an Anarchist. An active member of the L.A. theater community, she is an associate producer of Director’s Lab West; an associate member of the Theatrical Producers League of Los Angeles; a cofounder of the new play development organization, Circle Readings; and a member of the board of directors for the Los Angeles Downtown Arts District Space (LADAD Space), which will be opening a new arts complex in 2015. Wyenn holds a BFA in Drama from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts. 


Tony Shayne - Production Manager

Tony is a proud new member of the staff at REDCAT in Los Angeles. REDCAT is a premiere interdisciplinary contemporary  theatre on the West Coast, promoting innovative visual, performing and media arts.

Tony is currently working on a wide range of wonderful projects outside of REDCAT including Nationwide tours with Sheetal Gandhi and Rosanna Gamson/Worldwide. With Sheetal Gandhi, Tony is working in SF, NY, New Mexico and Florida in the coming months on her one woman show, "Bahu-Bitu-Biwi", featuring her signing, dancing and performance skills. 

For Rosanna Gamson/Worldwide, Tony is still Production Designing her touring show of "Layla Means NIght", which is an exotic and eclectic evening of food, drink, smells and visual delights. 

Kate Parsons - Video Artist
"In today’s media saturated world, we often live in a constant state of mental anxiety and chaos, a cacophony of stimuli and expectations. My work deals with this discomfort, which is not limited to a mere moment but is instead ever-present. 

I use a mix of analog video and audio to create a feeling of discord as each signal fights for airtime. This process, which can be considered a “hack”, results in the breakdown of the image, which ironically can produce formally pleasing results.
Ultimately, my current work is about failure and the struggle for power and control as realized through the use of technology. It references ideas from cognitive psychology, specifically cognitive dissonance, distortion, and catastrophizing.  "

Jessica Giacobbe                           (Directors Assistant)

Jessica Giacobbe is an artist/filmmaker from a small town outside Scranton, Pennsylvania. In 2014 She received her BFA in Multidisciplinary Fine Arts with a concentration in Film/Digital Video at The University of the Arts in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.  Her work is inspired by the idea of progress, specifically the stimuli initiating that progress. Examining life as a chemical reaction, viewing her work as an improvisational and catalytic process. Working heavily from intuition and finding that utilizing instinctual feelings of risk, trust, and reliance can create magic. 
Giacobbe has exhibited in many group showings such as Making It! Exhibition, Watch Your Step!, Crave, 5x7, and Art Unleashed in Philadelphia, PA.  She has been internationally exhibited in the ARCANIUM Video/Animation Festival  (Levenda, Slovenia).  In May 2014 she had her first solo exhibition, Catalysts and Aftershocks, at JAG Modern Art in Philadelphia, PA. 

In 2015, she will be a featured artist in the Biennial Edition of VIDEOFOCUS (Online Magazine, mid-2015).  She is currently the director's assistant for the upcoming mulimedia event, ALT-Mode (Premiering in Central Park NYC August 2015), and living in sunny Los Angeles, California.


Steve Teeple                                           (3D Animation)

Steve Teeple (better known as Teeps) is a digital artist currently residing in the the city of Oakland, CA. His work explores the continuously developing relationship between sight and sound, investigating the ideas of stepping away from the usual formats, to

explore 3D spaces and study visual perception. Twenty-twelve brought recognition and praise from IDN magazine, naming Garbure their video of the year, and a subsequent screening at the Volt festival in Stockholm. The reception for Steve’s work led his path to cross with David Wexler, better known as Strangeloop of Flying Lotus Brainfeeder label, founder of the Teaching Machine collective. Steve sculpted 3D models for the avant-garde, sci-fi animated film, Anamnesia, and created videos for RYAT, Ruff Draft/Mr Carmack, Earnest Blount, and more. Steve graduated with honors from the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee with a bachelors degree in Interdisciplinary Arts & Technology. 


Akiko Yamashita  Projection 3D Animation Artist

Akiko Yamashita a.k.a. VJ Drunk Boy is a projection mapping artist from Japan currently based in Los Angeles. She is proficient in both artistic aspect and technical aspect of projection mapping. Her largest work was Los Angeles City Hall(454ft/138m high) projection


WE NEED 63,500 to pay our artists for their time!

If we do not hit this amount, most will be donating extra hours, but we hope that the community finds our cause essential for the American Public. We have already donated many hours and weeks of time in putting this together. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this along to friends and donors who support women artist. Thank you for helping our vision be presented to the public, without commercial strings being attached!

story:
Hi, I am Nate, and I create under the name Anthelian. My goal is to provide the people in my community with quality instruments, hardwood sculptures, and paddles. For the last 22 years, I've been exploring art of all kinds from photography to music, painting to tattooing, and absolutely everything in between. Art has been my sole source of income my entire life, and continues to feed my family to this day. In all my years of doing this, my woodwork has never been more well received than now.

I have put a considerable amount of time, effort, and money into building my business and expanding my woodworking skills, but I need your help to grow further. Until now, I have been selling images and image transfers at events using the car I share with my partner. I could Tetris everything into place, settle into the empty spaces, and transport our wares where we needed. Now that I have so much more to move on the regular - between tools, materials, completed products, and upcoming vending commitments - I cannot continue without a more economic vehicle.

That's where I need your help. The perks I am offering are our normal products and more, at a vastly reduced price. 



Impact:

A van, as opposed to a car, will cut down expenses across the board. It will allow me to buy wood in bulk, which was prohibitive with a car either due to size or weight. I can transport my displays, furniture, and wares without the need for extraneous rentals. All of these savings translate to lowered prices for our clients in the long run.



Other ways you can help: 

If you aren't in a position to help by contributing - please help spread the word! 

Thank you <3 <3 <3 

-Nate / Anthelian & Penny
story_txt:
Hi, I am Nate, and I create under the name Anthelian. My goal is to provide the people in my community with quality instruments, hardwood sculptures, and paddles. For the last 22 years, I've been exploring art of all kinds from photography to music, painting to tattooing, and absolutely everything in between. Art has been my sole source of income my entire life, and continues to feed my family to this day. In all my years of doing this, my woodwork has never been more well received than now.I have put a considerable amount of time, effort, and money into building my business and expanding my woodworking skills, but I need your help to grow further. Until now, I have been selling images and image transfers at events using the car I share with my partner. I could Tetris everything into place, settle into the empty spaces, and transport our wares where we needed. Now that I have so much more to move on the regular - between tools, materials, completed products, and upcoming vending commitments - I cannot continue without a more economic vehicle.That's where I need your help. The perks I am offering are our normal products and more, at a vastly reduced price. Impact:A van, as opposed to a car, will cut down expenses across the board. It will allow me to buy wood in bulk, which was prohibitive with a car either due to size or weight. I can transport my displays, furniture, and wares without the need for extraneous rentals. All of these savings translate to lowered prices for our clients in the long run.

    Other ways you can help:  If you aren't in a position to help by contributing - please help spread the word! 
Thank you <3 <3 <3 
-Nate / Anthelian & Penny

story:
Explaining the situation

Dear visitor, I am Daniel Husztik, a Budapest based photographer, urban explorer, backpack traveller,  scout. I visited Iraq, Svalbard, Morocco and many other places to see the beauty of diversity in our world and I would like to share that experience with everyone.   I have imagined the project One Sentence, please let me tell you about it. Keep reading! :)


What is the One Sentence project?

The One Sentence project is about collecting peoples thoughts and advices while I am on the road in the summer. (I am not raising money for covering the travel expenses )    I will be visiting several countries - including the World Scout Jamboree  (here i intend to ask every nation) - , and taking pictures of  people I meet, and asking them to say exactly one sentence what they want to share the world with. By the end of the summer, these stories will be collected to one fine art book, published, and shipped all around the world. 

I think this project is a great opportunity to examine international relations, bring folks together, laugh, and learn about the world. It is about measuring the current state of the world, the hapiness in it, and how people think about life. 


Why I need your help?

The One Sentence project has two main expenses. The first one is the 35mm film it will be photographed on,  what needs developing, and the second one is publishing.

If you have the ability, please support this project, I will be grateful for that! All the rewards include shipping worldwide, so you don't have to worry about it!

In case you cannot afford helping me, please share this campaign to reach as many people as it can. 


Conclusions, and the future

Thank you for reading this story, I hope you like it. Please leave me reviews if you wish to, to improve the campaign. I will soonly add some videos and photos to the campaign as soon as I have time to do it.

story:
Our Story

Leeloo is an online community for upcoming Australian designers and emerging artists to have a web based environment within which to sell their goodies whilst continuing their focus on their practice.  The web site can be found here : http://www.leeloo.com.au  We are based in Sydney, NSW, Australia and are a very small community business.


I (Angela) started Leeloo with a mission to provide online commercial exposure to young people who show talent and need a start, but may not necessarily have the time or skills to do all of the work themselves.  Whilst a lot of these designers have their own Etsy stores (http://www.etsy.com), Leeloo provides an opportunity for them to be grouped amongst other like-minded Australian designers, and provides focused attention to their products within a nurturing community-based environment.


Renee joined our team nearly two years ago.  I met Renee through Leeloo, because she was a sweet young thing looking for someone who could help get her art out there.  Originally an artist and crafter that was part of the Leeloo family, she showed great initiative in wanting to learn the business, as well as work with me (Angela) on setting up exhibitions and how to kick-start her own career as a stylist. 

Renee is now an essential part of the Leeloo team, and provides enthusiasm, passion, hard-work and raw talent to all of our endeavours.Renee also has a successful blog of her own where she supports international art, design, photography and more. (http://www.renee-anne.com.au)


We spend a great deal of our time promoting the work of the Leeloo family, be it through press coverage, advertising, written editorial contributions both in print and online and pride ourselves in being able to give helpful advice to those who have just begun their journey from hobby to potential self-employment through something creative that they enjoy.  I (Angela) also provide ethical fashion styling services to people on the odd occasion (you can see some of my work on The Loop - http://www.theloop.com.au/app/people/portfolio/angela), and I prefer to use Leeloo family goodies whenever I can, or those from within the Australian indie community.


Leeloo is a 'curated' store, in that we take submissions from those who wish to be part of our team.  We also promote the work of the indie artistic and design community-at-large through our blog, as well as our regular stall at the massive Finders Keepers market, held bi-annually in Sydney, Brisbane and Melbourne. 


This further extends our support with exposure to new audiences for our team of designers and artists, and allows them the opportunity to have a presence at the market should they not have a stall themselves (either due to distance, cost or that their own submission was unsuccessful to have a stall).


We have also curated and completely project managed five art exhibitions, including Once Upon, DisBand, Drawn From Fashion.  Each of these exhibitions has been a theme based exposition of independent young Australian artists, not all of which are necessarily part of the Leeloo store itself.


Leeloo has been active for over three years now, and has carved a sweet niche for itself in the hearts of our followers, and in the loyalty of the designers and artists we work with, but we have hit a point in the life cycle of our business where we require some inspiration, guidance and new ideas.

The Impact

The first Etsy conference (Hello Etsy - http://www.helloetsy.com) will be held this year in Berlin in September.  The conference will focus on sustainability in small businesses and will include speakers and sponsors involved within the Etsy community, the worldwide community of designers and artists, and beyond.


In order to continue to gain the latest knowledge to support the Leeloo mission and the best kind of support to our growing family of designers and artists, for us to gain further knowledge and maintain our expertise in this area, it is imperative that both myself and Renee are able to learn from the world leaders in small online design business retail; Etsy and it's community.


Berlin being one of the world's top destinations for art galleries, exhibitions and other creative events, will allow us to experience first-hand the latest ideas in art, design, exhibiting, to see how the global benchmark is being set, and therefore bring these ideas and inspiration back home to not only Leeloo, but to share that vision with our local community, in both Sydney and Australia.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to buy our tickets to the conference which are 85 Euros each (x 2).

We need our accommodation for a week in Berlin which will be approximately 500 Euros (we'll be staying in small apartment rentals / bed and breakfast type accommodation).

We need money for our airfares, which at this stage will cost approximately $5000 AUD.

We'll also need some survival money for the week, for food and such.  We think that will be around $1000 AUD.

So, we're going to ask you lovely people to help us get at least partially towards our target.


Renee and I are currently going through our 'stuff'.  We're going to be holding an online garage sale to hopefully raise some of the funds we need and we'll be continuing to work towards our goal as we're super keen to get there. 


You can help us with a financial contribution ranging from $10 to $250.  Each level of contribution provides you with a perk.  Perks include raffle tickets, discounts, art prints and originals.  If you contribute any amount, you will know that you have supported our work at Leeloo, and therefore supported the Australian independent art and design community. We will be eternally grateful. :-)


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to assist us financially.  If you would still like to help us, please tell your friends and family and anyone who you think might be interested in our mission about our project.  Spreading the word always helps!  You can do this by sending an email link to our project, sharing the link on Facebook, or tweeting the link using your twitter account.  Thank you very much!

story:
Summary

We are Mike and Mari, and we make a podcast. We are hoping to upgrade our equipment and studio to facilitate having guests on the show!

  • Mike: I've been working with and learning about graphic design for the last 6 years. I began in high school with an introductory course in design and am now a junior at Oregon State University majoring in graphic design. I've worked both as a freelancer, production artist and full-time designer for myself, Embodee, and Oregon State Career Services respectively.
  • Mari: I was raised by a family of artists and have carried that with me throughout my life. I have immersed myself in creativity with every chance I get, taking art classes through middle school, high school, and beyond. I am currently a Fine Arts Major at Oregon State University working towards getting my Bachelor of Fine Arts (BFA) degree. I like to take a curious approach to my art, by being more hands-on and exploring my world and the capabilities of the mind to interpret this stimulus. I enjoy doing pen and ink drawings, as well as having an interest and fascination with special effects movie make-up.

Together, we look to entertain our audience with a unique perspective on art, as well as news from our campus and around the world.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the long and short of it:

  • We currently have a single microphone of low quality that we share to record the show. This is not ideal as we cannot have any guests on!
  • By funding this project, you will help us purchase equipment like microphones, pop screens, a mixer, headphones, cables, etc.
  • You will recieve different cool rewards based on the amount of money you donate to the show!

Other Ways You Can Help

Broke like us? We understand!

  • Listen to the show at mikeandmari.com
  • Share the page with your friends on facebook
  • Follow us on Twitter @mikemaripodcast

 

Thank you!

story:
My name is Rose Marie Cromwell and I have collaborated with the community of Coco Solo in Colon City (Panama) for the past 3 years. In addition to my involvement as a Fulbright Scholar, I have fund-raised and organized two Christmas parties, the latter for +500 people, and also volunteered my time to teach English classes to the youth.

Coco Solo is a “squatter community” of approximately 400 families living in the barracks of a former US Naval Base. The Panamanian Government relocated local families into the barracks in the late 1980’s when US military usage ended. Although they were intended as temporary public housing, 30 years later people remain and the infrastructure is shoddy at best. There is no running water and barely any electricity; the majority of the population is under 15 years of age.

To kick start a long-term and self-sustaining project, I, along with my collaborators, Lorena Endara and Keenan Lee are asking for donations to start a photography and digital literacy workshop program. Our preliminary goal is to offer this intensive course to the youth of Coco Solo on site. The classes will include slide shows, tutorials, shooting sessions, journaling and guided writing time. Participants will be encouraged to think critically about the photographs they are making and write pieces inspired by the content of their photography. Each student will also have a journal which they can use to organize their photographs and writing into.

Through this long-term effort, we believe that the community will benefit greatly. The youth of Coco Solo will acquire valuable skills in digital technology such as cameras, computers, etc. while at the same time learning to find and express their own voices, creativity, and self-esteem. The ability to self-represent will undoubtedly provide a life-long ability to lobby for their own needs, whether better housing, health, and/or education.

After each set of workshops is completed, the students, along with the mentors, will assemble a book that compiles the bodies of work altogether. The book will consist of photography and writing produced by the students during the workshop, as well as pages from journals. This book made by the students can then be published and sold to the general public with all profits returning to the community.

story:
THE BEACH. We all love the beach: An enduring physical expression of our world’s breath taking fragile beauty, where surfers ride their waves, families join nature for fun, our holiday dreams come true and to create memories for a lifetime. Our planet’s beaches are as powerful today as throughout human time; making up less than one per cent of the world’s landmass but are home to some of the planet’s most abandoned eco-systems. Every flowing grain of sand has its place, sculptured by wind, waves and tide, protecting us from roaring seas. Our coastlines are the most dynamic features on earth. From ancient civilisations to modern metropolises we have depended on our shorelines for food, trade, commerce and safety. Today 11 of the world’s 15 largest cities are located on a coast or river estuary. By 2025 it is projected that 75% of our population will live in a coastal area. The effects are starting to show. Over -development, poor coastal management and pollution are pushing this vital ecosystem to the brink. The multi-billion dollar business of sand mining, the building of dykes and jetties interrupt nature’s dynamic resilient process causing unintended damaging erosion elsewhere. Catastrophic weather events, rising sea levels and oil spills have ravaged many communities, and this is only the beginning.

THE BEACHPIX. ARTWORK The goal of BEACHPIX. as an Outdoor Art Project is to create awareness of changes taking place at one of the most beautiful places on earth and increase the significance of this issue in public opinion and improve people’s consciousness. With our artwork we evaluate, document and preserve 100 amazing coastal places on earth for your home. BEACHPIX. artwork gives everybody the chance to take action and support one of the most beautiful places on earth - The Beach. We offer a limited edition of unique hand crafted artwork that connects you to your dream beach at home. A virtual journey on your mobile device.

How we do this: We create a limited edition of "Beach Pictures". We have adapted the lacquer peel method to preserve soil and sand profiles that was developed around 1930 by the German geologist Prof. E. Voigt at the Institute for Geology, University of Halle, Germany. A thin film of diluted lacquer is applied by a spray or brush onto the smoothed face of a beach profile. After one or more layers of lacquer have been applied and allowed to dry, the film, usually reinforced by cloth is loosened from the face. The soil material will remain attached to the hardened lacquer, thus giving a natural replica of the sand profile in the form of a thin lacquer peel or lacquer profile of about 2,0 to 4,0mm preserving the authentic structure and character of the Beach. This relatively easy method is well suited to dry soils with a sandy to light clay texture. The result of the exercise is immediately visible. The lacquer peels are light in weight and easy to transport, to handle, to exhibit and to store.  Then the profile gets mounted on a stretched canvas frame. Finally you get a fine piece of hand crafted artwork. All used materials and production processes are measurable sustainable and 100% eco friendly. The first edition will be offered in three sizes, 10x1sqm, 20x0,5sqm, 40x 0,25sqm per Beach. With every BEACHPIX. comes a tagged QR Code Print on Acryl, connecting the artwork with the free BEACHPIX APP for mobile devices like the Apple iPad.

THE BEACHPIX.APP In a world where location-based services are becoming more popular and lucrative we  use the newest innovative technology. The App connects you at home direct to your dream beach. Geo tagging via GPS data allows to define the exact position of your piece of art at every beach. The easy to use App shows the 360o panoramic view of your beach, an overview map is showing all documented places and connects you with the community of other owners/supporters via Facebook. On FB we also post daily news and stories during the making of, offering transparent informations and polls to the interested community.

From the Antilles to Zakynthos, until now we have a temporary selection of the 100 most beautiful beaches and surf spots on earth.  The evaluation is based on different rankings that have been screened: Lonely Planet, Tripadvisor, National Geographic CNN GO, Bloomberg, Forbes, The Guardian, Surfline.com and Surfer Magazine.

We are working on this and will publish the final list asap on this site.

THE BEACHPIX. EXHIBITION We need visions of a sustainable life that interconnect with the sensuality, lust and passion of acting on our own, examples to follow! The BEACHPIX. exhibition intends to encourage this and to move the cultural and aesthetic dimension of sustainability into the common sense, making the amazing beauty of beaches arround the globe visible. The exhibition aims at raising awareness for how to think in transitions, interim solutions, models, and projects. Artistic questions and concepts for action increasingly aim at the multi-layered domains of ecology as well as towards enlarging their social resonance space. Sustainability needs a space for development in which the multiple interconnections between the existing wealth of knowledge and experience in the arts and sciences as well as the idea that each individual can be a part of this can truly unfold.

The BEACHPIX. exhibition demonstrates an artistic practice that contributes to the preservation of the planets most beautiful places, and intends to influence conscious consumer behaviour. We also showcase the artistic position in which the boundaries between art, activism and inventions dissolve and the experiences and methods of environmental initiatives inter-connect with artistic approaches. One should never fall into belief, a small group of imaginative, dedicated people can´t change the world. In fact, the world has never been changed by something else.

THE BEACHPIX. CARE PROGRAMS supports local coastal recreation communities through a shared goal of raising public awareness about beach conservation and inspiring people to help protect the most dynamic vital eco system on earth. With a part of our earnings we support organisations with focus on local initiatives like coastal community beach care programs. We deliver the equipment and know how to produce locally own BEACHPIX. editions to gain income for further local beach care projects. On the other hand we get alerts, representative  and measurable data form every local supported beach team that can be implemented in Google Earth or Apple Maps. We believe that this data is very interesting for the travel business too.

Because the question is no longer whether climate change is causing the erosion of coastlines and beaches, but by how much and how fast. The effects of global change is an increasing number of storms and probably  the intensity of storm surge. The climate models all suggest that those kinds of effects are happening and so coastlines arround the world are subjected to more pressure from storms. In addition of course the sealevel is rising as a result of warming of the ocean which expands the water, but also melting of glaciers and ice caps putting more water into the ocean. So those things acting together are a real challenge to coastlines. Its especially survivor in low line areas such als the Pacific Island Nations, Bangladesh, and elsewhere, but its also a problem in the developed world. Places like Florida for example are very low lined and are a subject to both, storms and sealevel rise. For coastal communities arround the globe, those eroding effects  isn’t a distant, abstract fear, it’s happening now and it’s threatening their way of life.

Next Steps Programming of the BEACHPIX application and our online appearance including online PR and Marcom Strategy incl. content development and implementation of a WCMS based online appearance including a store, social media tools, multi language SEO and a web tracking tool. Your seed capital will help us to launch the project, buying materials and equipment, hiring and training of 3 fair paid teams of students. Project start is planned spring 2013 until late autumn 2013.

But to have the cash on hand to run the project in its first months, before sales can escalate, we need to raise at least €10.000 in start up capital. Would you help us to turn our ambitions into accomplishments by helping with a sponsorship to help us get launched? Would you take action for one of the most amazing places on earth?

But time is limited. the Gruender-Garage, a competition for entrepreneurs created by Google, Indiegogo and Stiftung Entrepreneurship ends on October 12th..

Make a difference - sponsor BEACHPIX. now!

Many Thankz!

As further sales channels we will use our own online store, different online art and lifestyle platforms like for example the Saatchi Online Galerie, Etsy...AHA Life, but also gallery exhibitions, art fairs and special event installations. Of course we are searching for strategic partners to support the project. As for example NGO´s, and institutions to outdoor fashion and lifestyle brands, airlines or the travel business we´d like to welcome to support BEACHPIX.

Perks from € 5 to € 1.360,00 Starting with a public Thank You and Welcome to the comunity on our pages and getting updates of the ongoing process of our work, we offer you our Tshirt or a tin can with 100 grams of original sand from your dream beach that you have selected.

This are our special prices for the first limited edition and you will be one of the first getting your own BEACHPIX. art.

  • One of 40 BEACHPIX. from the Beach of your choice
    25x25 cm on canvas incl. 5x5 cm QR Code on acryl          € 85,00 
  • One of 20 BEACHPIX. from the Beach of your choice
    50x50 cm on Canvas incl. 5x5 cm QR Code on acryl        € 340,00
  • One of 10 BEACHPIX. from the Beach of your choice
    100x100 cm on Canvas incl. 5x5 cm QR Code on acryl € 1.360,00

All prices incl. free access to the BEACHPIX.APP. All prices excl. shipping costs. Optional we will offer different frames in our online store.
story_txt:
THE BEACH. We all love the beach: An enduring physical expression of our world’s breath taking fragile beauty, where surfers ride their waves, families join nature for fun, our holiday dreams come true and to create memories for a lifetime. Our planet’s beaches are as powerful today as throughout human time; making up less than one per cent of the world’s landmass but are home to some of the planet’s most abandoned eco-systems. Every flowing grain of sand has its place, sculptured by wind, waves and tide, protecting us from roaring seas. Our coastlines are the most dynamic features on earth. From ancient civilisations to modern metropolises we have depended on our shorelines for food, trade, commerce and safety. Today 11 of the world’s 15 largest cities are located on a coast or river estuary. By 2025 it is projected that 75% of our population will live in a coastal area. The effects are starting to show. Over -development, poor coastal management and pollution are pushing this vital ecosystem to the brink. The multi-billion dollar business of sand mining, the building of dykes and jetties interrupt nature’s dynamic resilient process causing unintended damaging erosion elsewhere. Catastrophic weather events, rising sea levels and oil spills have ravaged many communities, and this is only the beginning.

THE BEACHPIX. ARTWORK The goal of BEACHPIX. as an Outdoor Art Project is to create awareness of changes taking place at one of the most beautiful places on earth and increase the significance of this issue in public opinion and improve people’s consciousness. With our artwork we evaluate, document and preserve 100 amazing coastal places on earth for your home. BEACHPIX. artwork gives everybody the chance to take action and support one of the most beautiful places on earth - The Beach. We offer a limited edition of unique hand crafted artwork that connects you to your dream beach at home. A virtual journey on your mobile device.



How we do this: We create a limited edition of "Beach Pictures". We have adapted the lacquer peel method to preserve soil and sand profiles that was developed around 1930 by the German geologist Prof. E. Voigt at the Institute for Geology, University of Halle, Germany. A thin film of diluted lacquer is applied by a spray or brush onto the smoothed face of a beach profile. After one or more layers of lacquer have been applied and allowed to dry, the film, usually reinforced by cloth is loosened from the face. The soil material will remain attached to the hardened lacquer, thus giving a natural replica of the sand profile in the form of a thin lacquer peel or lacquer profile of about 2,0 to 4,0mm preserving the authentic structure and character of the Beach. This relatively easy method is well suited to dry soils with a sandy to light clay texture. The result of the exercise is immediately visible. The lacquer peels are light in weight and easy to transport, to handle, to exhibit and to store.  Then the profile gets mounted on a stretched canvas frame. Finally you get a fine piece of hand crafted artwork. All used materials and production processes are measurable sustainable and 100% eco friendly. The first edition will be offered in three sizes, 10x1sqm, 20x0,5sqm, 40x 0,25sqm per Beach. With every BEACHPIX. comes a tagged QR Code Print on Acryl, connecting the artwork with the free BEACHPIX APP for mobile devices like the Apple iPad.

THE BEACHPIX.APP In a world where location-based services are becoming more popular and lucrative we  use the newest innovative technology. The App connects you at home direct to your dream beach. Geo tagging via GPS data allows to define the exact position of your piece of art at every beach. The easy to use App shows the 360o panoramic view of your beach, an overview map is showing all documented places and connects you with the community of other owners/supporters via Facebook. On FB we also post daily news and stories during the making of, offering transparent informations and polls to the interested community.
From the Antilles to Zakynthos, until now we have a temporary selection of the 100 most beautiful beaches and surf spots on earth.  The evaluation is based on different rankings that have been screened: Lonely Planet, Tripadvisor, National Geographic CNN GO, Bloomberg, Forbes, The Guardian, Surfline.com and Surfer Magazine.
We are working on this and will publish the final list asap on this site.


THE BEACHPIX. EXHIBITION We need visions of a sustainable life that interconnect with the sensuality, lust and passion of acting on our own, examples to follow! The BEACHPIX. exhibition intends to encourage this and to move the cultural and aesthetic dimension of sustainability into the common sense, making the amazing beauty of beaches arround the globe visible. The exhibition aims at raising awareness for how to think in transitions, interim solutions, models, and projects. Artistic questions and concepts for action increasingly aim at the multi-layered domains of ecology as well as towards enlarging their social resonance space. Sustainability needs a space for development in which the multiple interconnections between the existing wealth of knowledge and experience in the arts and sciences as well as the idea that each individual can be a part of this can truly unfold.
The BEACHPIX. exhibition demonstrates an artistic practice that contributes to the preservation of the planets most beautiful places, and intends to influence conscious consumer behaviour. We also showcase the artistic position in which the boundaries between art, activism and inventions dissolve and the experiences and methods of environmental initiatives inter-connect with artistic approaches. One should never fall into belief, a small group of imaginative, dedicated people can´t change the world. In fact, the world has never been changed by something else.

THE BEACHPIX. CARE PROGRAMS supports local coastal recreation communities through a shared goal of raising public awareness about beach conservation and inspiring people to help protect the most dynamic vital eco system on earth. With a part of our earnings we support organisations with focus on local initiatives like coastal community beach care programs. We deliver the equipment and know how to produce locally own BEACHPIX. editions to gain income for further local beach care projects. On the other hand we get alerts, representative  and measurable data form every local supported beach team that can be implemented in Google Earth or Apple Maps. We believe that this data is very interesting for the travel business too.
Because the question is no longer whether climate change is causing the erosion of coastlines and beaches, but by how much and how fast. The effects of global change is an increasing number of storms and probably  the intensity of storm surge. The climate models all suggest that those kinds of effects are happening and so coastlines arround the world are subjected to more pressure from storms. In addition of course the sealevel is rising as a result of warming of the ocean which expands the water, but also melting of glaciers and ice caps putting more water into the ocean. So those things acting together are a real challenge to coastlines. Its especially survivor in low line areas such als the Pacific Island Nations, Bangladesh, and elsewhere, but its also a problem in the developed world. Places like Florida for example are very low lined and are a subject to both, storms and sealevel rise. For coastal communities arround the globe, those eroding effects  isn’t a distant, abstract fear, it’s happening now and it’s threatening their way of life.
Next Steps Programming of the BEACHPIX application and our online appearance including online PR and Marcom Strategy incl. content development and implementation of a WCMS based online appearance including a store, social media tools, multi language SEO and a web tracking tool. Your seed capital will help us to launch the project, buying materials and equipment, hiring and training of 3 fair paid teams of students. Project start is planned spring 2013 until late autumn 2013.
But to have the cash on hand to run the project in its first months, before sales can escalate, we need to raise at least €10.000 in start up capital. Would you help us to turn our ambitions into accomplishments by helping with a sponsorship to help us get launched? Would you take action for one of the most amazing places on earth?
But time is limited. the Gruender-Garage, a competition for entrepreneurs created by Google, Indiegogo and Stiftung Entrepreneurship ends on October 12th.. 
Make a difference - sponsor BEACHPIX. now!
Many Thankz!
As further sales channels we will use our own online store, different online art and lifestyle platforms like for example the Saatchi Online Galerie, Etsy...AHA Life, but also gallery exhibitions, art fairs and special event installations. Of course we are searching for strategic partners to support the project. As for example NGO´s, and institutions to outdoor fashion and lifestyle brands, airlines or the travel business we´d like to welcome to support BEACHPIX.

Perks from € 5 to € 1.360,00 Starting with a public Thank You and Welcome to the comunity on our pages and getting updates of the ongoing process of our work, we offer you our Tshirt or a tin can with 100 grams of original sand from your dream beach that you have selected.
This are our special prices for the first limited edition and you will be one of the first getting your own BEACHPIX. art.

One of 40 BEACHPIX. from the Beach of your choice 25x25 cm on canvas incl. 5x5 cm QR Code on acryl          € 85,00  

One of 20 BEACHPIX. from the Beach of your choice 50x50 cm on Canvas incl. 5x5 cm QR Code on acryl        € 340,00

One of 10 BEACHPIX. from the Beach of your choice 100x100 cm on Canvas incl. 5x5 cm QR Code on acryl € 1.360,00


All prices incl. free access to the BEACHPIX.APP. All prices excl. shipping costs. Optional we will offer different frames in our online store.

story:
Please help us raise funds and donate through this website to help empower kids in Hong Kong to reach for their dreams, and their potential to "BE". Through our art and inspiration we hope to reach out and make a difference to more children in our community. Act now!

 

 

ABOUT ART HOPE

ART HOPE is a non-profit charity project devoted to creating art for a good cause. Every 18 months, a series of inspired artworks are created by artist KA in collaboration with other creative individuals. It's aim is to raise money specifically for charities that support schools or kids with the focus on bringing inspiration and hope to those in need through art. For our Art Hope 2012 exhibition, the theme is "BE". We are proud to have Kids4Kids as our beneficiary charity this year and to have Hyde as our venue sponsor. The funds raised will go to seed Kids4Kids's 'Art for a Cause' 2012/2013 project(which encourages kids to use creativiy through art for a cause) to be officially launched on Nov 24th, 2012 at the Kids4Kids Day.

 


View the 10 paintings of "BE" exhibition : www.arthope.net

 

(50% of sales of paintings will be donated to Kids4Kids)

 

 Your donation and funds raised will be used to support the Kids4Kids "Art For Cause" Program 2012/2013 in the following ways:

- Renovation of Art Room @Lok Sin Tong (LST) primary school in Kowloon City

-Purchase necessary quality art supplies and equipment

-Start a weekly 'Art in the Community' program for LST students and kids in the neighborhood

-Support the organisation of 'Art For Cause" 2012/13 art competition that engage kids to use their artistic talents to create and give back.

  

Art Hope official blog: http://arthope.tumblr.com

 

The Art Hope team: http://www.arthope.net/about.asp

 

Kids4Kids: www.kids4kids.org.hk

 

  

 

ABOUT "BE" EXHIBITION

 ~Be true to your vision and to your heart~

                -CREATE YOUR LIFE-

  

What is the idea behind the ‘BE’ exhibition?

The idea is to capture the creative spirit of 10 individuals in Hong Kong in order to show their true state of being while they are engaging in their chosen creative field or life path. We will attempt to capture this invisible creative spirit by using a series of photos while the artist or creative is at work, to show the transient nature of the outward form and the power of the inner spirit. Using the photos as a source of inspiration, the essence of these will then be transformed into a series of powerful paintings produced by KA.

Who are these individuals?

Whatever their chosen path maybe eg. music, writing, design, painting, acting photography or social cause; these individuals all have one thing in common – an intense passion to create their own life. They know this is what their hearts call for and persistently want to pursue it in their lives. It is this powerful “being-ness” within the individuals that we would like to capture and share with the world.

What message is this exhibition trying to convey?

Creativity is derived from beyond the mind, from an invisible universal force. We hope to spread this force to all corners of Hong Kong and beyond. To inspire those who live in this mind and form dominated society to let go of their fears and to have the courage to embrace their child-like essence and just "BE"who they truly are.

 

ART HOPE Exhibition and Charity Event Details

WHEN: September 8, 2012 Saturday 7:30pm - 9:30pm

VENUE: HYDE, 2/F Lyndhurst Tower, 1 Lyndhurst Terrace, Central

YOUR SUPPPORT: 50% of bar sales will be donated by Hyde to Kids4Kids 

http://www.hyde.hk

story:
Our Story

Fresh Grounds Coffeehouse & Cafe is a non-profit coffeehouse who mission is to positively effect the lives of those in our community through building relationship, offering programs unlike anything already taking place in the community and a place for anyone of any age to come and relax, enjoy a cup of coffee of even just play a game all with the love of Christ. 

Fresh Grounds has been open for a year now. The process of opening took 3 and a half years of donated time and money and over 100 volunteers renovate the space, back to its (1890) original beauty.

The coffee shop has made quite an impact already in our greater community. Friday evenings have become a haven for 80+ youth who finally have a place to hangout. Our town has suffered major industry loss, being in the rust belt, and has yet to pick itself up off its feet... not yet.

We have great faith in our community, and although they have already been of great support to Fresh Grounds in our current operations and in the raising of salary for the few employees, we are ready for Phase 2.

My job at Fresh Grounds coffeehouse is the director and instructor for the nonprofit art program which I started here. I am currently evening manager of the shop but hope to relieve some of my duties with the coffeehouse part to be able to devote my full attention to the Art Program. I have a great passion for art, I recently received my Bachelors Degree in Fine Arts and have 3 years experience teaching and working with a non-profit organization. The college that I attended and received my degree from is the local college in town and I have been a member of this community for over 13 years. 

The Phase 2 project includes installing an elevator as per code requirements. The Art Program will take place on the 2nd floor of the coffeehouse. In addition to the elevator, some renovations will be needed in order for the space to be transformed into a gallery and studio for teaching classes.

I have already begun teaching classes in the coffee shop, making due with the little resources we have and since classes have started in the fall of 2010 I have successfully brought over 40 students through various courses including drawing, painting, photography and experimental art. I feel very strongly about having inter-generational classes and it has been a joy to see our youngest student (10) work so well with our oldest student (72).

The Impact

The program has already had two handicap students apply and complete a course, and although we were able to make due, I am excited for the day that they can easily access the renovated 2 floor space and also enjoy the gallery. 
Our area is also experiencing a shift in our public school funding and the art programs have been greatly effected. I am currently working with an elementary art teacher in the area, who is concerned about her job and realizes even the time constraints she has been given to effectively teach her students. The Fresh Grounds Art Program is committed to serving those in our community, making it affordable to all while still maintaining the excellence that is put into every shot of espresso, that has been put into the renovation of the building and that we will continue to put into every relationship built.

I feel that the arts is definitely getting people more connected and passionate about their community and hopefully will be that push to get our town back on its feet and the Fresh Grounds Art Program will be a crucial part of this revitalization. 

What We Need & What You Get

Most of the work, construction included, that still happens at the coffee house is done by volunteers which helps reduce the cost! Even some of the big ticket items that are purchased are sold at cost to help benefit the organization.  Great new track lighting has already been donated! We are also 501(c)3 so there is a tax benefit to donating.


$23,000

We have already started raising funds for the elevator and are currently in need of an additional $23,000 to reach our goal. The total cost of the elevator is $50,000. The $27,000 that has been raised to this point has been from local patrons of the coffee shop, a few banks and businesses have made contributions reaching the current total in the matter of 5 months since campaigning began. 


$5,000

A new Heating and Cooling system will need to be installed.


$2,000

Leaks from the roof will need to be repaired and damaged ceiling sections will need to come down and be replaced.


$5,000

Of the proposed budget this would be the first to be cut should the full funding not come in. That is support. Working in a non-profit environment has been difficult when it comes to raising a salary. I am still very short from my goal. I have taken measures to reduce the amount I need, including getting rid of my car. However, I am still looking for support at this time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations of materials for the art studio would be amazingly helpful!

Leaks from the roof will need to be repaired and damaged ceiling sections will need to come down and be replaced.

Working in a non-profit environment has been difficult when it comes to raising a salary. I am still very short from my goal. I have taken measures to reduce the amount I need, including getting rid of my car. However, I am still looking for support at this time. 
Other Ways You Can HelpDonations of materials for the art studio would be amazingly helpful!

story:
Hello, my name is Lewis Liski. I am a recent graduate of the Alberta College of Art and Design in 2012. In my work as an artist, I continually try to make something that effects an audience both in the arts and outside of it. 

Alternative Currency is the closest I've come to producing that. This documentary is about the Cultural Capital of Canada: Calgary, Alberta. A city that has been my home while going to school for the last four years. Throughout that time the most common question I would ask myself is where is my place in a city like Calgary as an emerging artist?

Alternative Currency attempts to answer that question by getting the broadest spectrum of the contemporary arts scene in Calgary and the professionals that work in it while at the same time profiling five emerging artists like myself about to enter into the arts community in Calgary. Some of the interviews include:

Herringer Kiss, Paul Kuhn Gallery, Trepanier Baer, Skew, TRUCK, Stride, The New Gallery, EMMedia, Untitled Art Society, The Glenbow Museum, MoCA Calgary, Art Gallery of Calgary, Pith Galleries, Haight Gallery, 809, CAM, Straw Gallery, ESKER Foundation, Illingworth Kerr Gallery, Jarvis Hall Fine Art, AXIS, Market Collective and CADA. As well as interviews with writers, curators, and working professionals in the Calgary Arts community.

Having said that, the documentary is about to enter post-production and will need some financial help if it is to be finished for the premier in September 2012. At this point the project is looking for funding specifically for post-production in editing.

The Editor is Julian Moule, a SAIT film student who has had recent films featured in the Calgary Underground Film Festival and has four years experience editing. I have allotted for a budget of 200 hours at this point which is the equivalent of $3600.00.

The edit suite we will be using is at CSIF (Calgary Society of Independent Filmmakers) in the Old Y building. They charge $10.00 per hour, $500.00 for a week and $1800.00 for a month. We will be renting more on a daily/weekly basis based on our availability to edit together and around other suite bookings. I have allotted for the 200 hours of editing in the suite which is the equivalent of $2000.00.

This initial financing of the $5600.00 will be crucial to the documentary finishing in a timely manner and maintaining its relevance to contemporary art in Calgary under the Cultural Capital spotlight for 2012. All funds raised from this campaign will be used towards the editing of the documentary regardless of whether or not we reach the goal of $5600.00.

Alternative Currency when finished will exist as a document of a time when Calgary was given a brief podium for arts and culture and what the arts community was like during that time. It will also serve as a forum for discussion on how we sustain a Cultural Capital after the spotlight for Calgary has dispersed. Lastly, it will shed some light on how emerging artists can think about the Calgary Arts community and how it could be and should be a place for artists to build a career.

If you decide to support Alternative Currency please know that you are part of a project to help sustain Calgary both culturally and artistically. If you are unable to support, please know that spreading the word about the documentary is just as valuable.

Follow the progress of Alternative Currency at: www.alternativecurrencyfilm.wordpress.com

And spread the word by sharing the Campaign Page through IndieGoGo.

 

Lewis Liski

Director of Alternative Currency: A Look at Contemporary Art in Calgary

story:
IN MY WORLD

My name is Alet, and I'm an artist living in Denmark. I make colorings for kids and different types of kids-art. I love creating stuff for kids, (and adults too, that still has a bit of the kid in them;)). So when my daughter at eight asked me one evening if I could make some cute messages for her to read, and put in her lunchbox for school, I started drawing right away. I loved the idea! And that evening 'In my world' was born. Dag Igland, who is a graphic designer, joined me, and he's been working with the layout of the posters, and he creates print-ready files of the images.

What we love about "In my World" are the expressive images and the positive messages, which can help raising the spirits of both kids and adults in our ever faster-moving daily life.

We have started to make 'In My World' boxes, each containing 20 small cards, so you can put a card in a lunchbox, in a pocket, or with a gift, just as a nice surprise. Kids love them, and so do we, so we need to do more! Ten different posters are now ready to get printed, and we can't wait to get started! In children's rooms, kindergardens and on classroom walls, these posters can be great reminders throughout the day, on being NICE to one another!

But, printing is expensive, and that's why we will try to fund the printing costs here on Indiegogo!  

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

 We need $1200 to print ten different posters, and expand our making of the 'In My World' boxes. 

The posters will be printed on 60x 60cm (23,6" x 23,6"), glossy art-paper, 135g/m². 

One poster is $20 plus $4 for shipping anywhere in Europe, or add $8 for shipping anywhere else in the world.

If you would like two posters, you'll get a $5 discount. Shipping costs will be the same as for one poster.

Prints will be shipped in sturdy poster tubes.  

One 'In My World' box is $25 plus $4 for shipping in Europe, or add 8$ for shipping anywhere else in the world. 

If you want several posters for a Kindergarden or a school, (or just want to decorate your livingroom:)) we have a nice Bundle Perk! For $115 you will get 8 posters, pluss 10 'In My World' bookmarks. We will have to come back to you regarding shipping costs on this one, since we are trying to get it as cheap as we can! 

For every five posters purchased, we will donate one for a children's hospital. And if you know of any cause near you that works for children, send us a message, and we will add the cause to our giveaway list!

Please help us spread the word to your families and friends, your local schools and kindergardens, and we will be forever grateful! Thank you so much, and please take a look at the rewards

 High quality, glossy art-paper, 60 x 60cm (and the copyright mark and e-mail adress shown in these pictures will not be printed on the actual posters;))

 

 

 

In My World boxes, each containing 20 small cards, so that YOU can put a card in a lunchbox, in a pocket or along with a gift, just as a nice surprise! 9x 9cm 

There are different ways to contribute if you don't need a poster!

We also need help spreading the word! Press the 'share' button, make a Tweet! Or call you friends! Help us spread this campaign, so that we can go  ahead, filling children's rooms, kindergardens and classroom walls with these posters! And hopefully they can be reminders throughout the day on being NICE to one another.

 

        

 

If we don't reach our $1200 goal, we will still go ahead printing some of the posters, how many different ones depends on the fund we raise.

story:
Short Summary (con traduccion completa en el blog, enlaces al pie)

I am a mature artist that began to experience art "full time" just a few years back. Due to life intricacies I had to abandon my early art career dreams to focus on my survival. Illness was the "gift" that brought me back full circle to fulfill my dream.

I began painting again in 2006. Sold a few works "spontaneously" through my blog. Soon came the local solo shows and; the international invites started in 2009. Since them, I must admit that in the past few years, the "bulk" of my work has been exhibited in Europe, South America and currently also in New York...
Most, if not all of the these opportunities, have come about via social media - much maligned by many.

I like the focus on this trip to be the people that made my development possible and, whom have extended daily support through their real long distance friendships. These are the people I am planning to visit/meet in person for the first time, even stay with!
I like to further explore this connections made using social media.

For that, I have (modestly or, unrealistically?) budgeted approximately:

$25.00 a day for logging and food, a total of $775.00 monthly
approximately $225.00 for land transportation, galleries, museums and other "incidentals".

I have lodging confirmed in 5 cities at the moment: Istanbul, Lecce, Arezzo, Málaga, Bilbao and Budapest. I will see how it unfolds once I am there... as word spreads I am in the "area".

I am looking forward for more friends to extent stay-at their-home invitations.... (For which, I have also budgeted a "living cost" contribution) and I would much prefer to live with local families.

I also have been planning an art residency (or two?). One of them being in a small village about i hr west of Barcelona. I think I will go there for a month or so… The prices are good and when I enquired about the possibilities of an exhibit, they responded: the villagers would surely love that. SOLD! I though it could be magical….

I believe it is important for the world to have a peaceful, connected society at all levels  - to experience  cyber relationships, which are real and, serve to bridge the gaps that otherwise distance and/or politics come between - to be recognized as a vital part of our contemporary and future daily living, and as such, a great provider of many positive opportunities to all that navigate it with caution and, and an open her heart and mind/trust, at the same time...

At the end, I would like to have an exhibition (would love it to be an itinerant one, if possible!!!) where I would exhibit paintings, photographs, installations and share in  talks about the journey, the experiences in addition, to a previously completed mural project (FiberFusion ... as summary of "the threads that bind us") with over 20 artists form around the world...

Ultimately, also as a writer, I would like to publish a book, a companion book perhaps?  (which could be ideally sold at the various exhibition sites....!! YES.

Thank you for your interest and kindness.
♥ Much love and light!

Alicia

 

P.S.: Istanbul to London in 6 months is No.1 item on my bucket list.

Blog:

1. Istanbul to London in 6 months – Preparations

2. Istanbul to London in 6 months: Surviving the preparations

3. Istanbul to London in 6 months (Not 7!): Checking and Double Checking

story:
Sun Seeds are iridescent, geometric, hanging sculptures.

They're made from a dichroic material. They change color with the angle of the light and cast beautiful rainbow shadows and reflections!

We originally made the Sun Seeds for an outdoor art installation.

Now we're offering kits to make your own Sun Seeds!

The pieces interlock, hooking together without tape or glue.

We're producing the Sun Seed kits entirely in-house.

They make great gifts for anyone who enjoys crafting, rainbows, geometry, or 3D puzzles!

Every kit includes:

  • Dichroic pieces for assembling the Sun Seed.
  • Assembly instructions in diagram and video format.
  • Cardstock practice kit for learning the basic technique.
  • Nitrile gloves to keep the dichroic pieces pristine during assembly.
  • Fishing line for hanging the Sun Seed. Sun Seeds are light weight and easy to hang off a hook, suction cup, or tree branch.

 

Rewards

We're offering Small, Medium, and Large Sun Seeds.

We've designed two of each size:

Small Sun Seeds

"Star Flower"
20 pieces
Diameter: 4.5 in (11.5 cm)
Assembly Time: 20 - 30 minutes
Assembly Difficulty: Easy

 

"Succulent"
20 pieces
Diameter: 4.5 in (11.5 cm)
Assembly Time: 30 - 40 minutes
Assembly Difficulty: Easy - Moderate

 

Medium Sun Seeds

"Mint"
30 pieces
Diameter: 10.5 in (26.5 cm)
Assembly Time: 1 Hour
Assembly Difficulty: Moderate

 

"Daisy"
20 pieces
Diameter: 7 in (18 cm)
Assembly Time: 1 - 2 Hours
Assembly Difficulty: Challenging

 

Large Sun Seeds

"Lotus"
60 pieces
Diameter: 11.5 in (29 cm)
Assembly Time: 1 - 2 Hours
Assembly Difficulty: Moderate

 

"Passion"
60 pieces
Diameter: 12 in (30.5 cm)
Assembly Time: 2 - 3 Hours
Assembly Difficulty: Challenging

 

Creators

Hi!

We're Toby Schachman, Ryan Alexander, and Monique DeSalvo. We've been collaborating together on art installations and sculptures for several years.

We created the Sun Seeds last summer for an outdoor art installation.

We had set an intention to make a mobile of dichroic sculptures inspired by plant life.

We love making things with our hands and we're always excited to learn new techniques for making things, whether origami, sewing, blacksmithing, welding, or woodworking.

We were playing with a technique for making curved, interlocking polyhedra (inspiration: Yoshinobu Miyamoto, Holger Strøm) and discovered that by elaborating the hooks we could create curved forms both plant-like and geometric.

We made countless paper prototypes, experimenting with how far we could take the technique and what kinds of shapes we could make.

We even made custom software to help us design the pieces.

Our favorite part of the process was always taking the flat pieces, fresh out of the cutting machine, and interlocking them together, one by one, and seeing the curved, symmetric forms emerge.

We were delighted with the response to our art this past summer, and now we're excited to be producing the Sun Seeds as a kit, to share this experience with anyone who, like us, loves making things with their hands!

 

Risks and Challenges

We're producing the Sun Seed kits entirely in-house over November and aiming to get your kits delivered before December 15. Update: orders placed October 22 or later will be made in our second batch (estimated delivery date January 31).

We've timed how long it takes us to make the dichroic material and cut the pieces. We'll be monitoring this crowdfunding campaign closely and will stop taking new orders if we approach what we can confidently produce in time for December.

This is our first time running a crowdfunding campaign, and we've noticed these things can hit snags. We're hoping to avoid that by producing the kits ourselves and not depending on any third-party outsourcing. If we do hit any unforeseen obstacles, we promise to keep you updated and do our best to get you your Sun Seeds on time!
